summary: The Freedom from Government Competition Act of 2025 aims to shift the provision of goods and services for federal agencies from the government to the private sector. It mandates procurement from private sources except in specific cases related to national security, mission criticality, or lack of private sector alternatives. The bill directs the Office of Management and Budget to issue regulations and conduct a study to evaluate agency activities and report to Congress annually on the progress of transferring commercial activities to the private sector.
